headline.main: Share Prices Advance on a Record Surge in Retail Sales

lead_paragraph: Stocks rose yesterday, led by blue chips, on a record surge in retail sales as consumers flocked to car showrooms in October, progress in the Afghanistan war and solid earnings from Hewlett-Packard. ''If retail sales are up, that means the consumer is not hibernating and consumer confidence regarding the market is not falling,'' said Peter Cardillo, director of research at Westfalia Investments.
abstract: Dow Jones industrial average is up 72.66 points, to close 9,823.61; Standard & Poor's 500-stock index gains 2.12 points, to 1.141.21; Nasdaq composite index rises 11.08 points, to 1,903.19; graph; chart (M)
